page.title: 03BISHOPFIELD FARM,SERLBY.
page.content: The farm is owned by D.Skelton & Sons, they own 180 acres and they rent 270 acres(450 acres altogether),the crops are sugarbeet=70 acres which is sold to the British Sugar Corporation (Newark).They have 3 workmen, with 5 casual potato workers for about a month.They have lots of vehicles including 6 tractors,a combine-harvester and lots of other kinds of machinery.They have only sheep on the farm,with 36 breeding sheep.Coming back to crops there are 50 acres of potatoes, which go on to be Walkers crisps(Leicester), there are 70 acres of vining peas, which go for freezing,280 acres of barley, some is grown for seed, which goes to Nickerson's, John Powling, Dunns, the rest is for animal feed.the hours worked are from about 7am-6pm, with 6 days worked in a week.
